contentrichtext.text: [[Image:Our Lady of Victories Basilica Camberwell.jpg|right|thumb|260px|Our Lady of Victories Basilica]] {{coord|37.8338|S|145.0566|E|display=title|region:AU-VIC_type:landmark}} '''Our Lady of Victories Basilica''' is a [[Catholic]] church located in the [[Melbourne]] suburb of [[Camberwell, Victoria|Camberwell]]. [[Romanesque architecture|Romanesque]] in style, it was designed by architect [[Augustus Andrew Fritsch]]<ref name="dimech">Dimech, A.: ''[http://www.adonline.id.au/buildings/ourlady.php Our Lady of Victories Basilica]''. URL last accessed 2008-04-25.</ref> (1866 – 1933)<ref name="fritsch">City of Boroondara: ''[http://www.boroondara.vic.gov.au/about/historyandheritage/resources/glenferrieroadintheedwardianeratrail/churchoftheimmaculateconception Church of the Immaculate Conception]'', November 24, 2005. URL last accessed 2008-04-05.</ref> and was completed in 1918. It is one of five churches in Australia with [[minor basilica]] status. The current parish priest is Rev. Michael Morgan. Our Lady of Victories occupies an imposing site in [[Burke Road, Melbourne|Burke Road]] and, in a city where most churches of the era are built in the [[Gothic Revival]] style, has a distinctive copper clad dome completed with a golden statue of the [[Mary, the mother of Jesus|Virgin Mary]]. == References == <references/> == External links == {{Commons}} [[Category:Basilica churches in Oceania]] [[Category:Roman Catholic churches in Australia]] [[Category:Churches in Melbourne]] [[Category:Religious buildings completed in 1918]] [[Category:20th-century Roman Catholic church buildings]] {{Melbourne-stub}} {{RC-church-stub}} {{Australia-church-stub}}
